#Text=Afghan government : More than 90 civilians killed by US airstrike
#Text=Sunday , August 24 , 2008
#Text=Afghanistan
#Text=Image : MarsRover .

#Text=Nematullah Shahrani , the Afghan government minister , has said that an investigation found that more than 90 civilians were killed in American led NATO air strikes early Friday in Azizabad , a village in Herat province .
#Text=" Most are women and children " She continued :
#Text=" They have claimed that Taliban were there .

#Text= We 're confident that we struck the right compound , " she said .

column1: #Text=Brig. Gen. Richard Blanchette , a spokesman for NATO in Afghanistan , said investigators verified the deaths of five civilians .
#Text=Probably relatives of the Taliban commander but the casualty numbers released by Afghan officials has not been confirmed by NATO .

#Text=Raouf Ahmedi , a spokesman for the western regional command of the Afghan army , said that the bodies of 60 children and 19 women were among the dead when Afghan military officials inspected the site on Saturday .
#Text=" We could n't and we have n't found any identification showing they are Taliban , " Ahmedi said .
#Text=Conflicting reports had earlier stated that a Taliban commander , Mullah Siddiq , was among those killed in the airstrike .

#Text=La'l Mohammad Omarzaisaid , district chief , said the bombed houses belonged to men who worked as security guards at an airstrip used by international troops that is 120km south of the city of Herat .
#Text=Many of the dead had , in accordance with Afghan tradition , gathered to mark the 40th day since the killing of a militia commander .
#Text=Ahmad Nader Nadery , an Afghan Independent Human Rights Commission researcher , said 15 houses had been destroyed and others were damaged .
#Text=He also confirmed that memorial ceremony was being held for Timor Shah , deputy militia commander allied with the Afghan police .
#Text=The death was related to a personal dispute .
#Text=The memorial had attracted relatives and friends from outside Azizabad that were staying overnight in the village .

#Text=General Jalandar Shah Behnam , the head of the corps for western Afghanistan , and commando major Abdul Jabar were fired for " negligence and concealing facts , " by Hamid Karzai , Afghanistan 's president .

#Text=The presidential decree also stated that " [ i]n the tragic air strike and irresponsible and imprecise military operation in Azizabad village in Shindand district , more than 89 of our innocent countrymen , including women and children , were martyred . "
#Text=Karzai had earlier appealed to the U.S. led coalition to avoid civilian casualties and be careful .
#Text=In a statement the council of religious leaders for western Afghanistan said " Once again the enemies of Islam have stained their hands with the blood of innocent people ...

#Text=A demonstration on Saturday by villagers and relatives of the victims used banners that read  Death to America " and a police van was torched .

column1: #Text=Recently an Afghan investigation found that around 47 civilians , most of them women , were killed on July 6 in coalition air strikes when they gathered for a wedding .
